title: Guest Room Attendant
description:
**Profile Summary**

The uniqueness of The Vineta Hotel requires a Housekeeping Room Attendant with personality underscored by the highest degree of people acumen to provide an immaculate housekeeping experience in regard to cleaning, servicing, and maintaining all guest accommodations.

* Delight our guests at every interaction, with a genuinely warm presence, friendly, sincere nature, drive for service excellence.
* Empty trash containers, vacuum floors, remove all dirty terry and replace with clean par to designated layout, remove soil, dirt, soap build\\-up and hair from bathroom mirrors, vanity, sink, toilet, shower walls, bathtub, shower curtain and floor.
* Check complimentary coffee, snack, and toiletry supplies in the room, restocking according to provided hotel checklist and policy.
* Remove soiled linens, towels, bedspreads, blankets, laundry bags and slips, from each assigned room and provide fresh replacements.
* Handle guest items with the utmost care and attention to detail.
* Transport any room service trays/items in guest hallways to the appropriate location.
* Submit all maintenance issues in guestrooms, Public Areas and back of house areas to the Engineering department through designated work systems and bring them to the attention of the Housekeeping management.

**Core Competencies / Requirements**

* Ability to provide a warm, friendly, and professional service at all times to hotel guests and fellow hoteliers.
* Ability to exert physical effort in being able to clean up to 13 rooms per shift.
* Knowledgeable of proper cleaning techniques, proper chemical handling requirements, and use of equipment.
* Strong interpersonal skills, exceptional communication skills.
* Able to follow through on direction, with minimal supervision. Ability to think independently, possess good judgment, proven problem\\-solving skills and effective decision\\-making skills.
* At least 1 year of housekeeping experience, preferably in a luxury hotel or resort.
* Excellent personal presentation and interpersonal skills.
* Strong time management skills: ability to multi\\-task, set priorities, and adjust to changing conditions. Willing to work in a fast\\-paced environment.

**Compensation**  
Competitive salary, wages, and a comprehensive benefits package.  
401(k) Retirement Plan  
Paid Time Off/ Paid Holidays  
Ongoing Training and Development Opportunities from our Masterpiece Academy.  
Complimentary Dry Cleaning for Employee Uniforms.  
Complimentary Hotelier Meal

**US work authorization is required.**

The Vineta Hotel is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Job Type: Full\\-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Sever/Bartender
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic Server/Bartender to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for mixology and providing exceptional customer service in a fast\\-paced environment. As a Bartender, you will be responsible for crafting delicious beverages, maintaining a clean and organized bar area, and ensuring a memorable experience for our guests. This role requires excellent time management skills and the ability to work effectively in both casual and fine dining settings.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare and serve alcoholic and non\\-alcoholic beverages according to standard recipes and customer preferences.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the bar area, including washing glassware and utensils.
* Manage inventory levels of liquor, beer, wine, and mixers; assist with ordering supplies as needed.
* Provide excellent customer service by engaging with guests, taking orders accurately, and delivering drinks promptly.
* Handle cash transactions efficiently using cash registers and Aloha POS systems while ensuring proper cash handling procedures are followed.
* Adhere to food safety regulations and responsible alcohol service guidelines at all times.
* Assist with banquet services or catering events as required, ensuring all beverage needs are met for large parties.

**Experience**

* Previous experience in the food industry or restaurant environment is preferred, especially in fine dining settings.
* Familiarity with Toast POS systems is a plus but not mandatory; training will be provided.
* Strong time management skills to handle multiple orders efficiently during peak hours.
* Knowledge of food safety practices related to beverage preparation and service is essential.
* Experience in catering or banquet services is advantageous but not required.

Join us as we create memorable experiences for our guests through exceptional service and expertly crafted drinks!

Job Type: Part\\-time

Pay: $2\\.83 \\- $5\\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Work Location: In person

title: Craft Cocktail Bartender
description:
The Barnett Hotel features the Lobby Bar, serving craft cocktails and Italian\\-accented snacks in a French Deco\\-inspired setting with late\\-night music, and the High\\-Five Pool Bar, a rooftop spot with firepits, small plates, seasonal cocktails, and city views. Bartenders will work at both locations.

**Summary:**  
Prepare beverage orders according to The Barnett Hotel standards and recipes. Manage guest flow around the bar, maintain cleanliness, and ensure an organized workspace.

**Core Focus \\& Essential Responsibilities:**

* Prepare cocktails and drinks to guests’ specifications while maintaining hotel quality standards.
* Handle payments following HRI cash handling procedures.
* Check guest IDs to ensure legal age compliance.
* Input guest orders accurately in the POS system.
* Maintain positive guest relations and current menu knowledge.
* Manage inventory for liquor, wine, beer, and other beverage ingredients.
* Perform side work and other duties as assigned.

**Essential Qualifications:**

* Ability to communicate effectively in English with guests, management, and coworkers.
* Prioritize tasks, manage time, and follow up efficiently.
* Maintain knowledge of hotel services/features and hours of operation.
* Understand and comply with HRI policies and OSHA safety guidelines.
* Ability to perform basic math calculations.
* Meet any legal requirements for alcohol service and maintain a flexible work schedule.

**Education \\& Experience:**

* Minimum 1 year bartending experience; 2 years in fast\\-paced bar or restaurant settings preferred.
* Legally required bartending certifications; Responsible Vendor (RV) Server Permit, or additional certifications preferred.

**Cognitive Abilities:**

* Understand and respond to guest service needs.
* Communicate clearly in English; additional languages encouraged.
* Solve guest and operational issues effectively.
* Perform basic mathematical calculations.

**Physical Demands / Work Environment:**

* Stand, walk, and sit continuously; lift/carry 25 lbs frequently, 50 lbs occasionally.
* Bend, squat, crawl, reach above shoulder level; use dominant hand for grasping, pushing/pulling, and fine manipulation.
* Work in a typical bar environment with ambient lighting and temperatures; exposure to extreme temperatures, dust, dampness, heights, and moving machinery possible.

HRI is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing fair and equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of protected status under Federal, State, or local laws.

Job Type: Full\\-time

title: Juice Barista
description:
**About Us**

Pure Squeeze Juice Bar is a local, farm\\-focused juice company dedicated to supporting San Diego farmers and crafting unpasteurized, cold\\-pressed juices made fresh daily. We believe in clean ingredients, community health, and zero food waste.

**Overview**  
We’re seeking a passionate, customer\\-oriented team member to join Pure Squeeze Juice Bar. In this role, you’ll craft our fresh, cold\\-pressed juices and engage with customers through friendly sampling in the plaza. You’ll help introduce new guests to our products, maintain a welcoming environment, and ensure every customer leaves with a great impression and a great juice.

**Duties**

* Wash, cut, and prep fruits and vegetables for juicing
* Hand out juice samples to plaza visitors in a friendly, non\\-pressured way to help introduce new customers to the brand
* Operate the POS system for order processing and cash handling
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the juice bar, ensuring compliance with all food safety and hygiene standards
* Engage with customers — answer questions, share product knowledge, and provide excellent service both inside and outside the store
* Confidently manage the shop independently when needed, ensuring smooth operations and great customer experiences even when working solo
* (Not required, but a plus) — Ability to drive and pick up produce from local farmer partners using a fully insured vehicle
* Occasionally assist with off\\-site events such as farmers markets, community gatherings, or pop\\-up sampling at high\\-traffic areas
* Contribute to ongoing improvements as the shop continues to grow and refine its systems; flexibility and a positive attitude are key

**Experience**

* Excellent customer service skills, with a friendly demeanor and the ability to engage positively with customers.

**What we need currently**

* Seeking **high\\-energy, customer\\-friendly team members** to engage with plaza visitors by offering free juice samples in a warm, non\\-pressured manner — helping introduce new customers to our fresh, locally sourced juices.
* Communicate key flavor or health highlights in a friendly, natural way
* **Primarily evening** shifts 4\\-8:30pm with occasional mornings shifts 8\\-4pm (Saturday and Monday)
* Starting pay $20/hour \\+ tips

Job Types: Full\\-time, Part\\-time

Pay: $20\\.00 \\- $21\\.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Strategic Sourcing Specialist
description:
**Glacier Restaurant Group,** located in Whitefish, MT, is seeking a detail\\-oriented, analytical, and proactive **Strategic Sourcing Specialist** to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast\\-paced environment, enjoys problem\\-solving, and values cross\\-departmental coordination to keep operations running smoothly.

**About Glacier Restaurant Group:**

Formed in 2007, Glacier Restaurant Group (GRG) has grown to become the largest Montana\\-based restaurant group. Included in the GRG family are MacKenzie River Pizza, Craggy Range Bar \\& Grill, Mambo, Latitude 48° Bistro, Max \\& Erma’s, Goodnight's Prime Steak \\+ Spirits, and Arandas. We are proud of our Montana roots and enjoy the work\\-hard\\-play\\-hard lifestyle that comes with this beautiful country surrounding us. Each member of GRG, from IT experts to the cooks in our restaurants, works toward the same mission. With our collective knowledge, commitment to having fun, and passion for food and the experience that comes with it, we are far from your standard restaurant group.

**Position Summary:**

The Strategic Sourcing Specialist supports Glacier Restaurant Group by ensuring the continuous supply of products at optimal costs, consistent with quality and brand standards. This position involves daily coordination with vendors, distributors, and internal departments to manage procurement, product transitions, contract compliance, reporting, and pricing.

**Wage:** 

This is a full\\-time, salaried position with benefits. Wage to be discussed with interview candidates. Dependent on experience.

**Key Responsibilities**

*Weekly / Monthly Tasks*

* Participate in weekly Sysco AE coordination calls to review upcoming product changes, LTOs, and phase\\-outs.
* Manage critical target inventory control, including purchase orders (POs), supplier coordination, and production recoveries.
* Maintain consistent communication with suppliers regarding shortages, substitutions, and allocation issues.
* Submit and track New Item Requests (NIRs) and ensure all Sysco coordination is accurate and timely.

*Daily Responsibilities*

* Manage order transmissions, confirmations, and E\\-invoice processing.
* Review out\\-of\\-stock and substitution reports; approve substitutions as needed.
* Adjust and manage POs 3\\+ weeks out; ensure supplier accuracy and follow up on production issues.
* Process Customer Care requests, including returns, SCARs, and credits.

*Category \\& Vendor Management*

* Support RFP development and supplier onboarding.
* Assist with contract renewals, rebate tracking, and compliance reporting.
* Maintain vendor relationships and ensure alignment with GRG quality standards.

*Administrative \\& Reporting*

* Maintain supply chain archives in Google Drive (contracts, trackers, specifications, vendor lists, etc.).
* Conduct pricing audits and monitor invoice accuracy.
* Prepare monthly and quarterly reports (trend analysis, spend vs. sales, rebate tracking, and PCI reports).
* Support culinary and R\\&D initiatives with sourcing, pricing, and documentation.

*Additional Functions*

* Collaborate with Operations on recipe builds, costing, and nutritional data.
* Assist with Beer, Wine \\& Liquor category management, including vendor builds, bid files, pricing, and reconciliation.
* Oversee CrunchTime software data accuracy for product builds, bids, and pricing uploads.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum 4 years of purchasing or sourcing experience (hospitality or food service preferred).
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with advanced Excel and reporting software proficiency.
* Excellent communication and relationship\\-building skills across departments and vendors.
* Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and the ability to multitask.
* Self\\-directed with a strong sense of accountability and urgency.
* Reliable transportation and willingness to work occasional evenings or weekends.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive Salary
* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Health Savings Account
* 401(k)
* 401(k) Matching
* Opportunities for Growth and Advancement
* Meal Discounts for You and Three Friends or Family Members
* College Scholarships Available for Family Members

**Why Join GRG?**

* Collaborative, people\\-first company culture.
* Opportunity to work with well\\-known restaurant brands.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.

title: Location Leader | Store Manager
description:
**What if your workplace felt like a youth group — full of laughter, learning, and people who care about each other’s growth?**  
**What if leadership meant not just managing, but mentoring — helping your team feel confident, capable, and cared for?**  
**Are you the kind of leader who finds joy in helping others grow?**  
**Do you thrive in a positive, people\\-centered environment where communication and care matter most?**

At our three locations, that’s exactly what we’re building. We’re looking for a **Location Leader** who believes leadership is personal and that doing the right thing always comes first.

You’ll have the flexibility to **support one primary location** while occasionally lending your leadership to the others — helping us stay connected as one strong, unified team.

**What Makes This a Great Place to Work**

We’re more than just a store — we’re a team that treats each other like family. Our culture is built around encouragement, communication, and shared growth. Here, you’ll find purpose in your work, the freedom to lead authentically, and the joy of seeing others succeed because of your guidance.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Team Leadership**

* Foster a sense of belonging where team members feel welcomed, safe, and supported.
* Offer gentle guardrails and clear instruction to guide performance and growth.
* Cultivate a positive, youth\\-group\\-style learning culture that’s fun, respectful, and growth\\-focused.
* Lead by example and always choose to do the right thing — especially when it’s hard.
* Train, mentor, and develop team members to achieve their full potential.

**Operations \\& Administration**

* Manage labor percentage, team scheduling, and staffing needs.
* Oversee daily opening procedures, in\\-store production, inventory, and ordering.
* Ensure all operational practices align with company values and brand standards.
* Monitor the team’s use of the location time clock and uphold timekeeping accountability.
* Use internal systems to track performance, production, and sales.
* Engage meaningfully with customers to build relationships and encourage intent to return.

**Inventory \\& Merchandising**

* Monitor inventory levels and place timely orders to maintain stock efficiency.
* Perform regular stock audits and collaborate with vendors or suppliers as needed.
* Maintain visual standards and ensure the store reflects our brand and values.

**Customer Experience \\& Sales**

* Lead your team to provide warm, respectful customer service that reflects our values.
* Use sales data to identify trends, optimize pricing, and drive growth.
* Engage with marketing efforts and store events that bring community and customers together.

**What You Bring**

* Proven experience in management or assistant manager roles.
* A leadership style that blends clarity, empathy, and consistency.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to operational details.
* A natural communicator who leads through listening, support, and collaboration.
* Experience in food service or team leadership is a plus — but not required.
* Openness to support multiple nearby locations (Kent, Covington, Puyallup) as needed, with one location as a primary focus.

**Compensation \\& Benefits**

* **Hourly Pay:** $21–$24/hour (based on experience, plus hourly tips)
* **Estimated Annual Income:** \\~$50,000\\+ **after 6 months**
* **Paid Time Off \\& Sick Leave included (32\\+ hours avg for PTO)**

**Why Join Us**

At our core, we believe in:

✔ **Being the best we can be**  
**✔ Bringing out the best in our people**  
**✔ Winning as a team**  
**✔ Profiting by making people happy**  
**✔ Always doing what’s right — for our team, our customers, and our community**

If you’re ready to make an impact in **Kent, Covington, and Puyallup** — and grow your leadership career in a positive, people\\-centered environment — **apply now and join a team where leadership is personal and values come first.**

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $21\\.00 \\- $24\\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Application Question(s):

* We are looking for a candidate that can travel between three locations, and manage primarily one. The three locations are Kent, Covington, and sometimes Puyallup. Does this work for you?
* Where are you located?
* What does good leadership look like to you?

Work Location: In person
